clinical_study.brief_title: The Relationship Between Microsatellite Instability and Efficacy of Fluorouracil Based Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Gastric Cancer After Operation
clinical_study.official_title: The Relationship Between Microsatellite Instability and Efficacy of Fluorouracil Based Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Gastric Cancer After Operation

collaborator.agency: the Second Hospital of Lanzhou University

brief_summary.textblock: The relationship between Microsatellite instability and efficacy of fluorouracil based adjuvant chemotherapy in gastric cancer after operation.

detailed_description.textblock: To explore the relationship between Microsatellite instability and efficacy of fluorouracil based adjuvant chemotherapy in gastric cancer after operation.

primary_outcome.description: The time from the primary operation to disease recurrence or death.

secondary_outcome.description: the The time from operation to death or the last follow-up.

arm_group.description: We use the immunohistochemical expression of mismatch repair proteins (MutS protein homolog 2( MSH2),MutS protein homolog 6( MSH6) and PMS2（postmeiotic segregation increased 2 ）) to Determine the MSI status . When two antibodies or more show negative nuclear staining of the tumor cells, the MSI state can be defined as Microsatellite instability high (MSI-H).

We use the immunohistochemical expression of mismatch repair proteins (MLH1, MSH2, MSH6 and PMS2) to Determine the MSI status. When one antibodies show negative nuclear staining of the tumor cells, the MSI state can be defined as Microsatellite unstable low (MSI-L).

We use the immunohistochemical expression of mismatch repair proteins (MLH1, MSH2, MSH6 and PMS2) to Determine the MSI status . when all the four antibodies show positive nuclear staining of the tumor cells, the MSI state can be defined as Microsatellite stable (MSS).

intervention.description: The microsatellite instability status are definite to three type:MSI-H, MSI-L,and MSS. The gastric cancer patients who received D2 resection were included in 3 groups：MSI-H group， MSI-L group，and MSS group. All patient must be accept fluorouracil(5-FU) based adjuvant chemotherapy. We will analyze the relationship between MSI status and efficacy of 5-FU based adjuvant chemotherapy by observing the survival period of patients with different MSI status.
